EmailTemplate.subject: Brookfield Infrastructure Debt Fund Update
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
To view this email as a web page, go here.
We would like to extend our gratitude for your continued support of Brookfield Infrastructure Debt Fund (“BID US”) and Brookfield Infrastructure Debt Fund (Europe) (“BID Euro”, and together with BID US, the “BID Funds”) and reaffirm our commitment to our infrastructure debt business. We continue to see a growing market opportunity for mezzanine debt investments in high quality, core infrastructure assets and remain confident in our investment team’s ability to deploy capital in this space on behalf of Brookfield and our investors.
To date, Brookfield has made a $200 million investment in Prumo Par,i $50 million of which has been placed into BID US and is currently performing above our target expectations.ii Additionally, we have recently committed to a €45 million debt investment related to the acquisition of Autovia del Camino (a toll road in northern Spain), which we expect to place into BID Euro.iii The global pipeline of investment opportunities for the BID Funds remains strong and the team has reviewed over 170 potential transactions since inception.iv Furthermore, we are actively negotiating term sheets on several prospective deals.v
As an update on the team, John Stinebaugh, Managing Partner, retains primary responsibility for overseeing investment activity and operations through his role as Head of Brookfield’s infrastructure debt business. John brings over 19 years of infrastructure and debt investment experience and leadership to the business, including 12 years of experience with Brookfield. As with other senior executives at Brookfield, John also has other corporate responsibilities within the infrastructure group.
Hadley Peer Marshall and Ian Simes lead global sourcing and execution activities for North America and Europe respectively devoting substantially all of their time and attention to that responsibility. They are supported by several investment professionals including Sean Robertson (Manager, Toronto), Andrew Ehrlickman (Associate, New York) and Mickael Deligny (Analyst, London). We are actively seeking to add additional team resources in the near term, commensurate with the growth of the business.
To further support these efforts, David Levenson (Managing Partner) has joined the Investment Oversight committees for BID US and BID Euro. David Levenson was previously Managing Partner and sector Chief Investment Officer (CIO) of Transportation within the infrastructure business before he was moved to the private equity group to assume responsibility of Brookfield’s credit hedge fund.
Consistent with our investment approach, we remain disciplined and patient in seeking well-structured investments with attractive risk adjusted returns for both of the BID Funds. We look forward to updating you on a number of these investment prospects as they progress.
Sincerely,
Sam Pollock, Senior Managing Partner
Chief Executive Officer of Brookfield Infrastructure Group
Sachin Shah, Senior Managing Partner
Chief Executive Officer of Brookfield Renewable Group
